poem:
"Paradox of Borders"

Mayorkas, in the morning still,
Defends the order on the Hill.
Threads of promise wear thin,
As doors to the south close in.
Numbers become bars of steel,
An invisible border's harsh seal.
Asylum requests fall like scattered stones,
Across barren fields of broken bones.
Criticism howls in the quiet cold,
A story of hope, untold.
prompt: You are the poet RS Thomas. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Mayorkas insists immigration order not at odds with Biden’s campaign promise The US homeland security secretary, Alejandro Mayorkas, defended both the timing and substance of Joe Biden’s new executive order to restrict immigration at the southern border, as the president faces criticism from Democrats and Republicans alike over the measure. The order, issued on Tuesday, tells officials to shut down asylum requests once the average number of encounters between legal ports of entry reaches 2,500". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
